A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A ship, vessel, boat. From pleo; a sailer, i.e. Vessel.
So that, therefore, so then, so as to. From hos and te; so too, i.e. Thus therefore.
A ship, vessel, boat. From pleo; a sailer, i.e. Vessel.

37.parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
37.str2: To fill, load. Transitive from gemo; to fill entirely.

38.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
38.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

38.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
38.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The stern of a ship. Feminine of prumnus; the stern of a ship.

38.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
38.str2: To sleep, be sleeping. From kata and heudo; to lie down to rest, i.e. to fall asleep.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A pillow or cushion. Neuter of a presumed compound of pros and kephale; something for the head, i.e. A cushion.

38.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
38.str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.

38.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
38.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

38.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
38.str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
A teacher, master. From didasko; an instructor.

38.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
38.str2: It is a care, it is an object of anxiety, it concerns. A primary verb; to be of interest to, i.e. To concern.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

38.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle - 1st Person Plural
38.str2: From apo and the base of olethros; to destroy fully, literally or figuratively.

39.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
39.str2: To wake out of sleep, arouse in general, stir up. From dia and egeiro; to wake fully; i.e. Arouse.

39.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
39.str2: From epi and timao; to tax upon, i.e. Censure or admonish; by implication, forbid.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The wind; fig: applied to empty doctrines. From the base of aer; wind; by implication, quarters.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably prolonged from hals; the sea.

39.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
39.str2: To keep silence, be silent, either voluntarily or involuntarily. From siope; to be dumb; figuratively, to be calm.

39.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
39.str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

39.parse: Verb - Perfect Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Singular
39.str2: To muzzle, silence. From phimos; to muzzle.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The wind; fig: applied to empty doctrines. From the base of aer; wind; by implication, quarters.

39.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
39.str2: To abate, cease raging, be stilled. From kopos; to tire, i.e. to relax.

39.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
39.str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Large, great, in the widest sense.
A calm. Of uncertain derivation; tranquillity.

40.parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
40.str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

40.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
40.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Cowardly, timid, fearful. From deos; timid, i.e. faithless.

40.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
40.str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

40.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
40.str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.

41.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
41.str2: From phobos; to frighten, i.e. to be alarmed; by analogy, to be in awe of, i.e. Revere.

41.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
41.str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

41.parse: Personal / Reciprocal Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Plural
41.str2: One another, each other. Genitive plural from allos reduplicated; one another.

41.parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
41.str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

41.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
41.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The wind; fig: applied to empty doctrines. From the base of aer; wind; by implication, quarters.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably prolonged from hals; the sea.

41.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
41.str2: From hupo and akouo; to hear under, i.e. To listen attentively; by implication, to heed or conform to a command or authority.

41.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
41.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
